items.title: HTC bets its open AI strategy to drive smartglasses sales
items.author: Wen-Yee Lee
items.summary: - HTC's VIVE Eagle AI glasses run on an open platform that supports multiple AI models (Gemini, OpenAI), enabling model switching. - The HK$3,988 device debuted in Hong Kong and will roll out to Japan and Southeast Asia in Q1 2026, with Europe/US later in 2026. - HTC emphasizes Asia-first design, cautious entry into China due to data rules, and that user data is not used to train its AI models, touting privacy as a differentiator.

items.title: South African rand gains as precious metals prices jump
items.author: Reuters
items.summary: - The rand rose about 0.4% to around 16.70 per dollar by 0744 GMT as precious metals surged.\n- Johannesburg's Top-40 index rose about 1.3% while gold hit a record and platinum climbed to its highest in more than 17 years.\n- Analysts warned the rand could test 16.70 again amid the metals rally, with year-to-date gains above 12%.

items.author: Reuters

items.title: China hits EU dairy products with provisional duties
items.author: Reuters
items.summary:
- China imposes provisional anti-subsidy duties on EU dairy imports (milk and cheese such as Roquefort) at 21.9%–42.7%, with most firms around 30%. 
- About 60 firms, including Arla Foods, face rates of roughly 28.6%–29.7%; some pay 21.9%–42.7% if not participating; duties start collection soon. 
- Moves follow a concluded probe and are seen as retaliation for EU EV tariffs; final ruling could revise duties as China tackles a milk glut.

items.title: Italy regulator fines Apple $115 million for alleged App Store privacy violations
items.author: Reuters
items.summary:
- Italy's AGCM fined Apple and two divisions about €98.6 million for abusing a dominant position in the App Store, citing “absolute dominance” over third-party developers.
- The probe found Apple imposed a more restrictive privacy policy from April 2021 and forced duplicate consent requests for data collection and advertising linking via the ATT prompt.
- Apple defends ATT as protecting user privacy and plans to appeal; AGCM deemed terms unilateral, detrimental to partners, and not compliant with privacy rules.

items.title: Elon Musk becomes first person worth $700 billion following pay package ruling
items.author: Reuters
items.summary:
- Musk's net worth surges to about $749 billion after the Delaware Supreme Court reinstated Tesla stock options worth $139 billion and the 2018 $56 billion pay package.
- The ruling overturns a 2024 decision, reviving the high-value package and fueling SpaceX IPO chatter and a historic $1 trillion Tesla pay plan approved in November.
- Reuters notes market reactions and comparisons to Google's Larry Page, highlighting unprecedented wealth concentration and attention on mega payouts.

items.title: Stellantis CEO says investments at risk in Europe after EU auto package
items.author: Reuters
items.summary:
- EU auto-package would drop the 2035 ban on new combustion cars; Filosa says the measures could curb investments and undermine growth and a resilient European supply chain.
- Stellantis says the proposals fail to address core challenges, notably a roadmap for light commercial vehicles and more flexibility on 2030 passenger-car targets, with automakers divided.
- Filosa warned there are no urgent steps to restore growth and urged clearer, committed policy actions to sustain investment in Europe.

items.title: Universal Studios in early planning stages for theme park in Saudi Arabia, WSJ reports
items.author: Reuters
items.summary:
- Universal Studios is in early planning stages for a potential theme park in Saudi Arabia, according to Wall Street Journal sources familiar with the matter.
- Comcast’s unit is conducting initial concept work; financing could come from a Saudi government-backed entity as part of a licensing deal with Universal.
- Reuters could not immediately confirm the report, and both Universal and Comcast did not respond to requests for comment; Comcast CEO Brian Roberts recently visited Saudi Arabia for an investment conference and the Qiddiya megaproject.

items.title: US FDA grants market authorization to six on! PLUS nicotine pouch products
items.author: Reuters
items.summary:
- The U.S. FDA granted market authorization for six on! PLUS nicotine pouch products from Helix Innovations LLC (an Altria JV) under a pilot fast-track program. 
- The mint, tobacco, and wintergreen pouches come in 6 mg and 9 mg nicotine strengths and may be marketed to adults in the U.S., with evidence of lower levels of harmful chemicals and a lower cancer risk versus other smokeless tobacco. 
- The approval covers only these six products; on! PLUS plans to resume retailer orders in Florida, North Carolina, and Texas and to launch e-commerce, with Zyn having received FDA approval earlier this year.

items.title: Fitch pushes Gabon's rating deeper into junk on soaring debt, tightening liquidity
items.author: Reuters
items.summary:
- Fitch downgraded Gabon's long-term foreign-currency IDR to CCC- and local-currency IDR to CC, citing widening deficits and tighter access to regional debt markets.
- Higher local-currency funding needs widen the gap with foreign IDs and reflect weaker appetite for Gabon debt in the latter half of the year.
- Gabon's debt is seen rising to about 80.4% of GDP in 2025 amid fiscal expansion, declining oil output, and ambitious public investments; World Bank warns of fiscal fragility.

items.title: Musk wins appeal that restores 2018 Tesla pay deal now worth about $139 billion
items.author: Tom Hals, Jan Wolfe, Abhirup Roy
items.summary:
- Delaware Supreme Court reinstated Musk's 2018 Tesla pay package, now valued at about $139 billion; milestones were met and his stake would rise to roughly 18% if all options are exercised. 
- A new pay plan approved in November could be worth up to $878 billion if targets are met, while replacing the old plan might have shaved as much as $26 billion from profits. 
- The ruling highlights governance and Delaware's influence; Tesla moved to Texas to enable a 3% ownership threshold for investor suits, a feature Musk would be uniquely positioned to exceed.

items.author: Arasu Basil

items.title: Exclusive: BofA bonuses will jump for investment bankers this year, sources say
items.author: Saeed Azhar, Milana Vinn
items.summary:
- BofA plans bigger bonuses for top investment bankers, with top dealmakers seen ~20% higher amid deal activity.
- It also targets a 50–100 bp rise in IB fee share over 3–5 years and a larger overall M&A bonus pool; discussions ongoing.
- Overall bonuses for traders and investment bankers are expected to rise this year due to deal volume and volatility, possibly the highest since 2021, per Reuters sources.

items.title: Canadian dollar steadies after mixed retail sales data
items.author: Fergal Smith
items.summary: - Canada’s dollar steadied around 1.3775 per US dollar, trading in a 1.3756–1.3801 range as the week ended little changed.\n- October retail sales fell 0.2% MoM after a 0.9% drop in September, with a preliminary November up 1.2%.\n- Oil rose about 1.2% to $56.80 a barrel ahead of possible Russia-Ukraine peace news, with yields higher and the dollar firmer on softer inflation.
